Senior Marketing Executive (Deputy Manager / Assistant Manager) Job at Beacongate Limited




        
    

        
        Beacongate Limited - Our client, a reputable financial services company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Marketing Executive (Deputy Manager / Assistant Manager)
Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Financial Services

Job Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Draw up an articulate marketing strategy for every financial year as well as monthly sales action plans
	Liaise with brokers to obtain information regarding generating profitable businesses
	Provide effective market intelligence to drive marketing efforts
	Effectively coordinate and support team members in new business acquisition from brokers and other market segments
	Aggressively pursue participation of the company in all profitable businesses available through brokers and other market segments
	Source for new brokers and develop other direct clientele through networking
	Ensure achievement of set targets on revenue generation and premium collection
	Perform administrative tasks including maintaining records and follow up on policy renewals
	Attend meetings, seminars, and programs to learn about new products and services, new skills, and receive technical assistance in developing new accounts
	Assist in inspection of properties and surveys to assess insurance risks (general condition, construction type, age, and other characteristics)
	Check documents to ensure zero errors before delivery to clients and brokers
	Develop and maintain a robust database on the market, clients, and prospects
	Develop and maintain constructive and cooperative working relationships with brokers and other clients
	Attend to other duties assigned by the Head of Branch/Department
	Follow up on outstanding payments and ensure strict adherence to the company’s credit control policy
	Prepare daily, weekly, and monthly marketing reports on production, collection and renewals.


Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities


	Excellent relationship management skills including persuasion, negotiation, summarizing, and presentations
	6 to 12 years in marketing of insurance products and services
	Ability to manage multiple clients effectively
	Strong understanding of key issues affecting target clients
	Excellent written and spoken English communication skills
	Creative, innovative, and entrepreneurial mindset
	Strong strategic thinking capabilities.


Desirable Knowledge & Experience:


	Knowledge of customer service principles including customer needs assessment, service quality standards, and customer satisfaction evaluation
	Knowledge of insurance laws and regulations and client business operations
	Strong business focus orientation
	Demonstrated technical credibility in insurance marketing.


Remunerations


	Deputy Manager - N9,700,000 - N12,600,000 per annum
	Assistant Manager - N 6,000,000 - N8,500,000 per annum


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: beacongatejobportal@gmail.com using "Senior Marketing – Deputy Manager or "Senior Marketing – Assitant Manager" as the subject of the mail.

Note: Applications without relevant insurance marketing experience will not be considered.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources Officer",
  "description": "Stretch-it Concepts -&nbsp;Our client is&nbsp; a growing company in the sales and distribution of mobile phones, operating through a structured network of sales agents and supervisors

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Officer in a Mobile Phone Sales and Distribution Company

Job Location:&nbsp;Agege, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Hybrid
Industry: Mobile Phone Sales &amp; Distribution

About the Company


	As we continue to scale, we are seeking a competent and hands-on HR Officer to manage our people operations, drive supervisor performance, and ensure smooth day-to-day HR activities.


Role Overview


	The HR Officer will be responsible for handling all HR functions and operations, with a strong focus on supervisor management, performance monitoring, and workforce coordination. This role is critical to ensuring that supervisors effectively manage agents, meet targets, and operate in line with company standards.


Key Responsibilities
HR Operations &amp; Administration:


	Handle end-to-end HR operations including recruitment, onboarding, deployment, confirmation, and exit processes
	Prepare and manage employment documentation (offer letters, contracts, warnings, termination letters, etc.)
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records for agents, supervisors, and office staff
	Manage attendance, leave records, and staff schedules

About the Company
     

            
    




	As we continue to scale, we are seeking a competent and hands-on HR Officer to manage our people operations, drive supervisor performance, and ensure smooth day-to-day HR activities.


Role Overview


	The HR Officer will be responsible for handling all HR functions and operations, with a strong focus on supervisor management, performance monitoring, and workforce coordination. This role is critical to ensuring that supervisors effectively manage agents, meet targets, and operate in line with company standards.


Key Responsibilities
HR Operations & Administration:


	Handle end-to-end HR operations including recruitment, onboarding, deployment, confirmation, and exit processes
	Prepare and manage employment documentation (offer letters, contracts, warnings, termination letters, etc.)

	Manage attendance, leave records, and staff schedules
	Ensure proper filing, documentation, and HR reporting


Recruitment & Workforce Planning:


	Coordinate recruitment of sales agents, supervisors, and support staff as required

	Liaise with supervisors during agent onboarding and deployment


Supervisor Management & Performance Management:


	Directly manage and coordinate supervisors.
	Set clear performance targets and KPIs for supervisors in line with company sales objectives

	Identify performance gaps and recommend training, redeployment, or disciplinary action where necessary

	Develop, update, and enforce HR policies, procedures, and codes of conduct

	Educate supervisors and staff on HR policies and expectations


Training & Development:


	Identify training needs for supervisors and sales agents

	Support supervisors with people-management best practices


Payroll & Compensation Support:


	Support payroll preparation by validating attendance, performance data, and deductions

	Assist management with compensation structure reviews for agents and supervisors


Reporting & Management Support:


	Prepare regular HR and performance reports for management
	Provide insights on staff performance, turnover, and operational challenges
	Support management in improving people processes and operational efficiency


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 years’ proven experience in an HR role (HR Generalist / HR Officer).
	Strong experience managing field staff, supervisors, or sales teams is an added advantage
	Good understanding of HR operations, performance management, and employee relations
	Strong organizational, communication, and leadership skills
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple priorities
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and basic HR reporting tools
